newsitem.title: FRANCE: Five dead, two missing in French Alpine accidents.
newsitem.headline: Five dead, two missing in French Alpine accidents.

text.p: Five people were killed, seven were injured and two were missing in a series of mountain climbing accidents in the French Alps on Thursday, rescue services said.
The most serious mishap was in the Haute Maurienne area near the Franco-Italian border where an avalanche hit a party of 17 French mountain troopers, killing four soldiers and injuring seven others,
The avalanche swept away the climbers on the Evette glacier at an altitude of 3,200 metres (nearly 10,000 feet), rescue services said.
An unidentified German woman was killed in a fall on Mont Blanc above Chamonix while two climbers went missing on the Aiguille du Glacier, also in the same area, officials said.
